pullRequest.title: Fix class unloading processing in classBySignature cache
pullRequest.bodyText:
When caching the result of TR_J9ServerVM::getClassFromSignature
we incorrectly assume that the class loader of the referencing constant pool
is the same as class loader of the resulting class.
The problem is that when we delete unloaded classes from the cache,
we use the actual class loader as key, instead of referencing one
which will result in entries for unloaded classes not being deleted properly.
This commit fixes it by keeping track of which class loaders reference
a class in ClassInfo. When processing unloaded classes, we find
correct entries for deletion by retrieving class loaders from
ClassInfo.
Closes: #10397

nodes.bodyText: Why don't we add methodClassLoader in this case?
Is it possible to have a NULL cached clazz? If not, then we don't need another test, but rather add an else statement to if (it != classBySignatureMap.end())

beforeCommit.message:
Fix class loader mismatch in classBySignature cache

When caching the result of `getClassFromSignature` we incorrectly
assume that the class loader of the referencing constant pool
is the same as class loader of the resulting class.
The most frequent case when that is not true is when a non-system
class references a system class, thus the class loader of the result
will be the system class loader. The problem is that when we delete
unloaded classes from the cache, we use the actual class loader
as key, instead of referencing one which will result in entries
for unloaded classes not being deleted properly.

This commit fixes the issue by caching using the actual class loader
of the result and storing which class loaders referenced each cache
entry.
In the case that we have a cached entry but detect class loader
mismatch, we are allowed to use the cached entry only if the class
loader
referenced this class previously.

Closes: #10397

Signed-off-by: Dmitry Ten <Dmitry.Ten@ibm.com>

afterCommit.message:
Fix class unloading processing in classBySignature cache

When caching the result of `TR_J9ServerVM::getClassFromSignature`
we incorrectly assume that the class loader of the referencing constant pool
is the same as class loader of the resulting class.
The problem is that when we delete unloaded classes from the cache,
we use the actual class loader as key, instead of referencing one
which will result in entries for unloaded classes not being deleted properly.

This commit fixes it by keeping track of which class loaders reference
a class in `ClassInfo`. When processing unloaded classes, we find
correct entries for deletion by retrieving class loaders from
`ClassInfo`.

Closes: #10397

Signed-off-by: Dmitry Ten <Dmitry.Ten@ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: This is a typo: == needs to become !=
